npm install -g bs-platform
bsb -init my-new-project -theme basic-reason
cd my-new-project
yarn build # or npm run build, for npm
node src/Demo.bs.js
JS has no distinction between integer and float.
type point = {x: int, mutable y: int}
This is the Reason spiritual equivalent; it doesn't mean it compiles to JS' object! To compile to the latter, see
We can simulate tuples in JavaScript with arrays, because JavaScript arrays can contain multiple types of elements.
Again, only a spiritual equivalent; Reason doesn't have nulls, nor null bugs! But it does have
for when you actually need nullability.
let add = a => b => a + b
Both JavaScript and Reason support currying, but Reason currying is
built-in and optimized to avoid intermediate function allocation & calls
might not be of length 2. Switch to pattern-matching instead.
In Reason, "sequence expressions" are created with
and evaluate to their last statement. In JavaScript, this can be simulated via an immediately-invoked function expression (since function bodies have their own local scope).
